title: Citibank Greece's Securities & Fund Services, Global Transaction Services Ranked First in Clearing and Settlement of Transactions for the Athens Stock Exchange in the First Half of 2011
summary: Athens – According to official data of Hellenic Exchanges SA, Citibank Greece's Securities & Fund Services (SFS) Global Transaction Services ranked first in clearing and settlement of transactions in the Athens Stock Exchange during the first half of 2011.
tag-1: Citibank Greece's Securities & Fund Services, Global Transaction Services Ranked First in Clearing and Settlement of Transactions for the Athens Stock Exchange in the First Half of 2011
tag-2: Athens – According to official data of Hellenic Exchanges SA, Citibank Greece's Securities & Fund Services (SFS) Global Transaction Services ranked first in clearing and settlement of transactions in the Athens Stock Exchange during the first half of 2011.
tag-3: More specifically, Citibank Greece ranked first in both categories, clearing 15.58 percent and settling 27.58 percent of total transactions (further details at http://www.ase.gr/content/gr/ann.asp?AnnID=131270).
tag-4: Citibank Greece's SFS, GTS has ranked first in clearing and settlement of transactions in the Athens Stock Exchange since the fourth quarter of 2010 (beginning September 27), when the specific statistics were issued for the first time following the introduction of Clearing Members in the equities market. SFS, Citibank Greece also ranked No. 1 for the first quarter of 2011, clearing 15.17 percent and settling 27.13 percent of total transactions.
tag-5: Citibank's Securities & Fund Services, Global Transaction Services, has been operating in Greece since 1989, offering institutional investors services that have been top-rated for the past 12 years in a row by one of the most respected surveys worldwide, Global Custodian Survey, as well as by the Global Investor and ICFA (International Custody & Funds Administration) surveys.
tag-6: SFS clients are Greek and International institutional investing mainly in stock exchange-listed products, Bank of Greece's Government Bonds and T-Bills, but also to Greeks who invest abroad in similar foreign products through a unique network spreading to more than 100 countries all over the world.
tag-7: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com.
